Reviews.Title: “Good stay, very friendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Igne Stankevici... A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in this hotel at the end of Feb for 1 night. The receptionist ( cant remember the name- the guy, in his 40s 50s was very helpful and friendly and was going extra mile to make our stay enjoyable Room was clean, a bit small , but would not expect something big in Paris, Location was perfect, - couple of minutes from metro and Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Chackos
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in january and found the hotel staff to be as cold as paris was then.i had ordered a special romantic package for my wife and they forgot about it ,i had to remind them and they got out a wine that was dusty from the cupboard..breakfast was ok..dont expect much help from staff or locals..since we been there before we knew how to get around otherwise we could have been well and truly stuck or help......

Reviews.Title: “Not so cheap accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ad2008Birmingham
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed there for 2 days in jan for our honeymoon.location was good for local sightseeing and thats all.food places can be really expensive around the hotel,my advice cross the bridge to bir hakeim metro station where there good food places around.staff can be not so helpful,but rooms were cleaned durin our two day stay and since we been to paris before we knew how to get around otherwise i can say it would have been pretty much difficult getting around..all in all not to expect too much but a decent accomodation for the money you pay and an ok breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “NEAT COSY HOTEL A BREATH FROM THE EIFFEL TOWER”
Reviews.Author: solomou_eva
Reviews.Content: Clean warm and quiet hotel in the 16th Arrondissement, just a three minute walk from the Trocadero Square and the Eiffel Tower. We were looking for a hotel in that area - where we have stayed again and love it - and we selected it for its price: good value for money. Small rooms - but we've seen smaller ones in Paris! The personnel was very helpful. Its absolute advantage is the location. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel that felt like a bed and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: babykitty_00
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on price and location. Being the high summer season, the rate was exceptional, so I wasn't expecting too much other than a clean place to sleep. Boy was I surprised! The hotel is so charming, the front desk staff couldn't have been nicer and they really made my first trip to Paris unforgettable. The room was small, yes, but very cozy. Once the staff knew I was on my own in Paris for the first time, they bent over backwards to help me. I never once passed the front desk without them asking if I needed directions, or maps, or sight seeing suggestions. One morning I had to be out early and arrived in the dining room before the kitchen was open. The wonderful woman at the front desk went in and made me coffee! And the location was PERFECT. A five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and Trocadero subway station. Great neighborhood with cafes and shops...and a market and post office directly across from the hotel. I honestly could not have asked for more. I will definitely stay there again on my next trip. Thanks Longchamps Elysees!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but for one reception staff member!”
Reviews.Author: paul s
Reviews.Content: Great location. 5 minutes from Trocoderro Metro and a great view of the Tower Only concern was one morning a member of reception went litteraly mad and started screaming and shouting at a guest over a dispute over a 1 euro bill! We and other guests were having breakfast behind the reception and the whole episode was totally unsatisfactory. the guest wasnt shouting but got upset at been shouted at! The other reception staff were very nice and helpful. hotel was clean and everything else was good Hope they read this as that staff person needs help!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - crazy manager!”
Reviews.Author: Annette S
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 3 night visit. We had booked a quad room which wasn't suitable for us wehn we arrived - one of the beds was a camp bed. The hotel staff offered us a double room at a discounted rate for the remaining 2 nights - which was great. When we went to check out yesterday, there was a charge on our bill. When we asked what the charge was for, the manager verbally abused us. I was told I was fat, disgusting, vulgar. He screamed at me for approx 10 minutes - telling us to pay our bill and get out or he was calling the police!!! At no point did we refuse to pay for anything - but we wanted to clarify if the additional charge was because they thought we'd used the minibar, or was it the city tax. I tried saying that I only wanted to ask a question - but he continued screaming. All of this in front of a lot of hotel guests. In particular, in front of my 13 year old niece. I've never been shouted at like this before - it ruined our entire trip. I wouldn't mind, but we had wanted to thank the staff for helping us find a room that was more suitable for us and made our visit more enjoyable...... what a disgrace!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning small hotel in a perfect area of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola M
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two days in the middle of November and absolutely loved this hotel. Rooms are small, yes, but this is what you should expect when you stay in an original building in Paris. The owners have made very good use out of the space in rooms, we had plenty of room to store clothes, etc. Our room also had very large windows which you could fully open to make the best use of the view. Hotel is very clean and well maintained, lobby area is especially nice. Breakfast was ideal for us, some pastries and condiments with a hot drink. It was all we needed to start our busy days. The front desk staff are also very helpful, one in particular gave us amazing directions to a restaurant we wanted to go to. The hotel is in a brilliant area, a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel tower and Trocadero metro stop and has some very nice pubs and restaurants nearby. All in all, a brilliant little hotel. My friend and I would definitely stay here again, and my glowing reviews have encouraged my parents to book and stay there next year! Thanks for the lovely stay to all at the Longchamp Elysees :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graham J
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Paris on business and needed a hotel for two nights near the Avenue Klebber and after reading reviews booked this hotel. Small and compact but very good value for money. The rooms are small as pointed out in some other reviews but remember this is a hotel in the heart of Paris and an original building. For me it met all my requirements, clean, tidy, frendly staff. The bedding was fresh and clean and the bed was comfortable and I slept well. I was able to attend my meetings feeling fresh and well slept. Tip; There is a lift if they do not mention it when you book in. It looks like a cupboard oposite the stairs but functions very well. Again in keeping with this type of hotel it is very small and would take a suitcase and one adult. More importantly and the real measure is that I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Pablo C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The room was very tiny for three people, but we made it work. The bathroom was even smaller with very limited space at all to move around. The location is great though as it is within a 10 minute walk to the metro and the the view of the Eifell Tower. The front desk staff was very helpful, especially the day we departed as we left at 6 in the morning. Breakfast starts at 7 in the morning, but the front desk person was very nice and provided us with breakfast, coffee, and juice. It definitely placed the punctuation mark on our vacation. The only major negative I have is one similar to another post I saw on tripadvisor. A week after returning from Paris, there were two fraudulent charges on my credit card. This was the ONLY location I used the credit card at as I paid cash for everything else. Now I have to go through all the hassle of closing my account and setting up a new card.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OJFamily_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. ALL of the staff were helpful and polite. Our booking had been canceled due to an expired credit card number and the staff bent over backwards to accommodate us - they found us a room just when we thought we would have to sleep in the Metro! WE can't thank them enough for that. We could fault nothing during our stay and so close to the Eiffel Tower, Metro and Trocadero where you can catch the 'hop on hop off' open top tour bus that we can highly recommend. Breakfast was included which was filling but not so good if you're watching the carbs but they do make a great hot chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and really enjoyed our stay. The front desk people were really friendly and spoke English very well. The room was large compared to other Paris hotels. The only reason that I'm not giving 5 stars is that the bathroom was very small, the pillows need to be replaced and the internet is a bit pricey. Otherwise, it's a great place for a great price about 5 minutes from the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Ontario O
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with two teenage kids for three nights mid July. Airplane landed before the room was ready at 1pm and hotel stuff quickly responded to my email in english welcoming us to leave our luggage until the room becomes available. After arriving around 9am we were surprised the room was available ahead of time so that was very pleasant news. Quad room consists of one queen size bed and one twin bed that has another twin bed underneath (rolls out). With four large suitcases lying around it would become crowdy at night. However, Paris rooms are much smaller than North American ones and we haven't spent much time in there anyways. Washroom with bathtub was quite large and extremely clean. Breakfast was included (which was a bonus as they go around 12-15 Euros per person) and it was basic European baguette, croissants, fruit yogurt, coffee/tea etc. Very fresh and quite good. Internet was a bit of pain as Paris hotels seem to allow only one device (can't have Blackberry and laptop on it at the same time). Try to use free WiFi where available as this is pay-per-use service here. I believe Wifi was charged at 13 Euros per day, but luckily online deal for this hotel had it listed as included and receptionist gave it to us for free during our stay. There is wall-mounted small LCD if you care with some satellite channels (we didn't care much). All in all, hotel is very pleasant, staff friendly and english-speaking. Make sure to at least try to speak French when in Paris. Everyone seems to appreciate the effort. Keep in mind that Paris can get quite windy/rainy, even in July. Luckily we had wind jackets on us. Eiffel tower is within minutes away as well as Trocadero metro station for other sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Marcopa59
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great facilities for a family. The service is excellent, especially the education at the reception. O hotel is located just five minutes from Trocadero and has a door to the subway station, shopping and good restaurants. Certainly, when we return to Paris, we stay in Longchamp Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ChinggisKhaan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this clean hotel set in a safe neighborhood within easy walking distance of the Trocadero and Eiffel Tower. Our room and bathroom were small but adequate. Breakfast was fairly standard for France. There are a number of cafes in close proximity as well as a small convenience store. We found the front desk staff to be polite and helpful. There were not a lot of amenities at this hotel but that was not important to us as we spent as much time as we could touring Paris. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: M&CMother
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Longchamp Elysees. The location is extremely convenient - it is a small hotel off a major street, 1.5 blocks to the subway and about a 10-15 minute walk to the Tower. Front desk staffers were generally friendly and all spoke English. I thought the breakfast was fine, though my husband went out and bought fruit after the first day to supplement. The rooms are very small, but adequate. We were there during a heat wave and had the AC on - the problem was that it was a unit jutting from the wall into the room and after the first day, it started dripping, leaving a musty smell in the room. The bathroom, especially the shower stall, is quite cramped.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MickScotland1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated next to the trocadero landmark, very close to champs-Ã©lysÃ©es it is the perfect hÃ´tel if you are not planning on spending too much time in the room. Rooms have probably not been redecorated since the 70's and the small flat screen tv almost looks a bit odd. (btw only two channels were working). Being in Paris should be a culinary experience. Not there as the only choice you have in the morning is tea or coffee. You'll be brought bread and butter, a small croissant and a pain au chocolat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Longchamp in Paris is a small hotel in a very central location in Paris. As usual for a central location in Paris the rooms are small, with a tendency for modern design. However, the rooms are actually not as nice as they look on the website. The rooms are well maintained and clean, but the bathroom had a slight mildew smell to it. The shower and water pressure were great though and really made you wake up in the morning. There is a minibar, TV and AC in the room. WiFi is also available at a rather decent charge compared to other hotels. The hotel is located in a side street and has a rather small lobby area. The elevator also is not for the claustrophobic. Breakfast is available and follows the French style with baguettes, croissants, jam, juice, coffee/tea, and a youghourt served at the table. The breakfast room has a view into a little courtyard with bamboo. Nothing spectacular, but still a nice feature. The breakfast staff is a bit indifferent. Check in/out is very friendly and efficient. Overall this hotel is not a bad choice if you are fine with three star accommodation. Prices are still high, but then this is a given in Paris and this hotel probably provides a decent value proposition. The location is definitely a plus and the best of Paris' views are just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location”
Reviews.Author: Lyse-Scott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Longchamp with our 12 year old daughter (triple room - queen bed & one single). The hotel room itself is very small and in need of a make-over. It would look completely different if it had new paint and decor - you could then excuse its size. Having said that, the bathroom was more spacious with great shower pressure and hot water. The toilet was tiny - almost as small as in an aeroplane! Breakfast consists of bread sticks, croissants, cheeses, jams, tea, coffee and a yoghurt. So much bread in France and the one thing I did miss was a cereal or anything that didn't involve breads!! The breakfast room is clean, tidy and friendly, with lovely kitchen staff. Wifi is charged by the half hour which is a shame, but I did have half an hour for free - so thank you. I would like to see the small garden balconies have a make over too, I think it would really make this hotel come alive. The location of this hotel however is ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC - just a short walk to both the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe with easy access to the subway to go further afield. We could sit in the dining area in the evening and have a glass of wine - the staff were more than happy to provide some wine glasses. The restaurant at no.54 Brasserie de la Poste was beautiful with great staff and a chef who invited us into the kitchen to teach me how to make his sauce! We felt really at home at the Longchamp and would like to make special mention of Marc who could not have been nicer or more helpful. We really enjoyed having a chat with him about our countries.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL !!! WONDERFUL STAY !!! MANY THANKS !!!”
Reviews.Author: moldov
Reviews.Content: Hotel longchamp elysees is a really nice Hotel !! I come to Paris every year with my wife and some friends. It was our first time in this hotel but not the last one !!! We had a wonderful stay in a wonderful place !!! Rooms are nice and clean like home !!! Staff were so nice and kind with us. Durind day and night all the staff is here to help you like you were in a palace !! Thanks to all the team of the Hotel !!! I recommend this place to everyone !!! Thank you so much and see you next year !!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: boubaquatrebornes
Reviews.Content: i spend my Easter holiday at this hotel the location is good very nice hotel the staff is wonderful rooms are nice and clean breakfast is very good. thanks to all the staff .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: buggea
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short break at this Hotel all the staff we really polite and helpful whatever time of day and always accomadating. Good Points. Staff, Superb location 5 min walk to Eiffel tower 10 min walk to Arc de Triomphe , Continental Breakfast good Not so good points. Rooms on the small side and could do with some TLC small things like bathroom door lock not working we stayed in room 501 had a window which did not open fully and we overlooked the rear of various other properties..not the best view! Bad Points. Price although we only paid 98 Euros per night with breakfast which i felt was about right the advertised price of 225 euros per night in my opion is way overpriced Conclusion I would stay there again purely on location but would not pay the full price. I would rate this Hotel as a 2 1/2 star not quite a 3 star due to rooms not quite up to prevoius standard 3 star hotels we have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, but be careful with credit cards used here.”
Reviews.Author: shan22699
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in ideal location, 5 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower. That's it's biggest USP. Rooms are quite clean, albeit a bit small and congested, especially for a family of 4. With the beds in place, there is hardly any room to be able to even walk to the bathroom! Service was ok, the desk staff were friendly in helping with directions to local attractions. But be careful with credit cards used here for reservation/payment purposes. After a couple of months of using my credit card here and returning home, I found to my dismay, a fraudulent charge on it for about $1100 by a car rental company located in Paris! It doesn't look like the hotel staff do a good job of keeping the old receipts/reservation slips securely. I had to go through the inconvenience of having to cancel my card and get a new one issued.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: alysonsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location. The staff were exemplary, especially Marc, who could not be more kind and accommodating. The ladies on staff were exceptional. This was my 4th trip to Paris; the accommodations were the best overall for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: corcaigh1963
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms with dirty carpets and dirty bed covers, building work going on from 9am during the weekdays, the smallest lift I've ever seen, room for only one person to pass on the winding staircase that often had obstacles like hoovers abandoned on them. Most of the staff were friendly, the breakfast was good and the location was handy, the "tax" charge at the end of the stay was a bit unexpected and was the final nail in the coffin for me, my advice is look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good position but rather low level ...”
Reviews.Author: elisaal73
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel is optimal: 5 minute walking from Trocadero and tour Eiffel, where you can take the Metro and visit all the city; located in the best Paris district (XVI arrondissement). We stayed there for 4 days (2 adults and 2 kids) but the room was too little (we didn't have the place to walk to reach the toilet!!). The furniture is not beautiful, rather dated, and the walls and the fixtures would need to be repainted; the curtains were stained and the toilet was not shining: I was expecting a little more from a 3-stars hotel. Instead, the breakfast was ok, but not outstanding. I would recommend this Hotel only if you want to be in a very good position and if you don't care too much about the appearance of the room.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: ROMEOALFA2010
Reviews.Content: The HOTEL is excellent, and the best of the HOTEL is Mr. OMKAR! Mr. OMKAR gave the best attention and service every day!!! I really recommend this HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Location/Location/Location”
Reviews.Author: pushaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Longchamp Elysees was truly a wonderful place to stay - walking distance to the Eiffel and many other Paris attractions. Marc, at the desk, was truly in tune with the needs of the hotel guests - he was amazing. Hotel was reasonably priced and presented a lovely continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Staff, Perfect Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Daboosh1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Longchamp Elysees with some colleagues for a business travel in Paris and we had a wonderful time in this hotel. After a business day in Paris, the only thing that you need is a good hotel with a nice location. The hotel have evrything: good quality, nice rooms, good breakfast, ideal location with restaurants and shops around, 2 minutes from trocadero and Eiffel Tower (during the night, the lights are amazing !). The staff is wonderful and friendly. This hotel is a really good value. We recommend this hotel to everyone, for business or for tourism; Go there, you will love it

Reviews.Title: “An excellent week in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ben158bc
Reviews.Content: On first approach, Im very difficult at using maps i tend to just explore (unfortunately not a possibility with hotels) however the hotel is in a prime location and only 1 street away from a perfect view of the eiffel tower perfect for sunrises and sunsets. The staff were brilliant by the end of the stay all of the staff new my room number to give me my card key and even what i wanted for breakfast. The breakfast was brilliant especially as being served 7 till 11, It's actually all morning so you have NO chance of missing it! you only about a 10 minute walk from the eiffel tower itself, and 5 minutes from the local metro. I highly reccomend visiting the cinequarium if you arrive earlier than you expect it really is a spectacle. The Facilities in the hotel were good, plenty of plug sockets for charging your cameras laptops e.t.c. the internet facilities were extremely cheap and fast, and although i didnt use the mini bar it had an excellent selection of drinks. All in all this has been a brilliant holiday with excellent staff and a prime location!

Reviews.Title: “Super Value, Super Service and importantly Super Location!”
Reviews.Author: MSA84
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful return to Paris, the staff from first contact to when we left could not do enough for us, one could not ask for a better location minutes from the Torcodero, minutes from the Effel Tower, minutes from the Arc de Triumpe, it is in a beautiful and importantly one of the Safest neighbourhoods of Paris. Catch the metro or more easier the number 72 bus to get you around to the Louvre, or the Royal Palais or Notre Dam. I looked on the net far and wide, and yes there are probably better hotels, but you will be hard pushed to find one of better value and location, location! I have stayed in numeroud hotels in differant chains across the major cites around the world, but for location and value this was up there. The Hotel rooms are typical of those to be found in Paris not huge, the rooms was small, but hey we were here for the sights and Paris not just the room, the bed was very clean and comfortable, as was the bath. The staff both night and day were excellant and could not do enough for us from providing advise in saving money and time, such as booking the trip to the Eiffel and boat trip on line, they did this for us at receptio to providing service. requirements for chargers, tea, looking after the luggage after check out to advising of a car park space. They made our stay extra unforgettable...I would strongly advise check this hotel before others because it could not be easier, provide excellant value and its that word again fantastic location! Its not the Ritz, but for Value, Service, and Location you will not beat it! We will definately be coming back for sure !!!....

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe and convenient location but very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: SM_Hongkong
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nites. The staff in the first day was extremely nice and helpful but the staff for the next two days were just average. The furnishing of the room was a bit old but acceptable. I just wonder why I need to pay 12 Euro so called city tax on check-out as I had paid the package price in full when I booked the package in Hong Kong. I did not need to pay such tax for the next 2 nites in another hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: boilermaker2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at Hotel Longchamp Elysees. The staff was excellent, location to see the sites in Paris was perfect and the price was great for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JVSch
Reviews.Content: Located near trocadero metro stop and not far from the Eiffel Tower. Price was very good for the area. Second time we have stayed here. Brought friends from Holland with us on this trip and they were very pleased based on European expectations. Staff is very helpful and had great restaurant ideas. Included breakfast - rolls, croissants, jams, yogurt, cheese. Rooms are a little small but adequate since we are typically out all day and just return to change or go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “'Magnifique' A Honeymoon to remember!”
Reviews.Author: 255060Kelly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Longchamp has a beautiful frenchy vibe, the staff (especially Marc) were fabulous helped us with everything from food to fun. The rooms were extremely comfy and homey feeling very clean and kept clean daily.Breakfast was a perfect start to a big day in paris with big jugs of hot coffee and crossiants mmm!!! My husband & I spent 10days here and loved it so much it was our own little home in paris. Also Fantastic loation in trocadero 1min from Eiffel Tower and only minutes from the Arc De Triomphe. Thanks Again to Marc he was so so good to us From Nick & Kelly xxx

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the 1st floor”
Reviews.Author: callita70
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close the the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast was very simple but very good quality and good service. But make sure not to be given the room in the 1st floor, which is supposed to be for 4 and barely fits 2 , has no window and opens directly to the dining room. After the very unpleasant first night we were moved to the third floor and let me tell you it made a whole difference staying at a more spacious room with windows to the exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile! :-)”
Reviews.Author: MrLatchman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and a freind. The rooms were a fair size & clean. Plenty of storage space for a long weekend. Its not the ritz but hey its a quarter of the price! ;-) This is a nice small cute hotel. The staff really made us feel welcome. They were very accomadating & freindly. For the cost of the rooms and the service with a smile :-) I would stongly recommend this hotel for anyone on a tight budget or for someone that wants to be in the heart of Paris a stones throw away from its vibrant bistros and restauarants. MR V Latchman

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL TIME..WONDERFULL LOCATION ...WONDERFULL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: ambrebabzoe
Reviews.Content: i have no words to describe the wonderfull time i spent in this hotel...its super nicely located...5mn walks from the trocadero and eiffel tower...in one of the most beautifull and safe neighbourood of Paris... the hotel is very nice, the staff are really nice and helpfull as well..they will make your stay unforgettable...i really wish i had knew this hotel earlier.... i will for sure come back there.......

Reviews.Title: “From now on, My hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: judithpatron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a week vacation in Paris. I had been there 20 years ago but it was my husband's first time in Paris. We wanted a local regular size hotel but the main concern was the location. I really wanted something very central. The Longchamp Hotel was suggested to us by a friend and we don't regret it. The location is perfect, the staff is very welcoming and helpful and spoke good english which was very much appreciated. The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable and the price very reasonnable for this very expensive neighborhood. We will go again for sure. Thanks for make our trip so nice!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience while being in Paris for business!”
Reviews.Author: AlowaGolan
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel that was just behind the Trocadero. I just love the area! I was extremely well surprised by the welcoming of the staff as soon as I arrived to the Hotel Longchamps. The very nice concierge escorted me to open my room and show me where I would stay. Very clean room and bathroom. Fresh smell of bed sheets. It wasn't the biggest room ever, but for myself or even with some company was a perfect size! I stayed there for 3 nights, and would definitely recommend it to anyone for its great location, very nice and friendly staff, and especially how clean was my room and bathroom each time I came back after a long day. Will definitely return there for my next trip to Paris. Thanks a lot. David Golan

Reviews.Title: “mediocre hotel near the eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: lou_lou_in_hk
Reviews.Content: stayed here 4 nights in the unusually cold part of May. receptionist/concierge - speak a little english - provided a very basic (also skewed) map for reference - efficient check-in and -out - past midnight, the nightshift staff hangs out in the lobby, watching tele and unlocks the door for you. i thot that was a nice touch lift - as small as they described - we managed to fit 2 large suitcases and 2 grown asians in there - serves all 5 floors, so wait is long during peak hours room - we had room 504 - heater was working - the single window facing the opposite building was rather bleak in the cold - coffee smell in the morning from ground floor cafe/reception area - small flat screen tv mounted on wall - remote for tv was phillips but the tv was of another brand - carpet was a bit dirty and danky - bed was hard - small closet with hangers - wifi was not free - small fridge stashed under writing desk bathroom - good water pressure and light - clean enough - hairdryer available - barely any shelf space for own stuff tho the area - walking distance from eiffel tower (15mins) and tocadero metro station (~8mins) - pretty florist on the corner of street - cafe with free wifi at the corner one block away - convenience store one block away overall, its a decent 3 star. price was reasonable for the area. but on hindsight, i would have paid a bit more to enjoy a better bed or a more convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Great well located little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OopsAdelaide
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms are small but typical of Paris Hotels. What makes this little hotel charming is the location. A short walk to some of the most beautiful sights in the world. After seeing the tourist sights a wander around this charming district is delightful. Very good cafes abound on every corner. I found my room on the fifth floor to have many more amenities than others I have stayed in in Paris. It was quiet enough to allow me to sleep off some serious jetlag through most of one day. Wifi is available and cheaper if you buy a larger block and you can log on and log off. The Staff are polite and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “friendly clean and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: s_hicks2
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel fri and sat night,room rather small but was very clean and we really only used it to sleep and change,staff very friendly,and always wanting to help,from booking moulin rouge tickets to booking transfer back to airport(which was cheaper than bus).very close to all sight seeing (advise taking les cars red sightseeing bus, which you can get off wherever and get on next one when ready and ticket lasts 48hrs) fully recommend this hotel, great time had by us both

Reviews.Title: “Nice Days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cherrypashka
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris together with my friends for 3 days. Have chosen this hotel due to the location (just 3 minutes from Trocadero and terrific view!) and the price. From these point of view we were not disappointed. We had tree rooms for all of us: single was really nice - small a bit like all rooms in Paris, but really nice; twin at the 5th floor was very cold; triple was nice and spacious. Breakfast was nice although not much choice was offered: juice, tea or coffee, some fruit, cheese, jougurt. The only thing I did not like - is expensive internet in the lobby - 5 euro per 30 minutes. Finally: nice and cheap hotel in the great location!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sianyCologne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our our 2 year old and as a result were given what I think was the quadruple room - a small room already with a double bed, then had a sofa bed and a cot added so it was very tight! it seemed pricey but probably wasn't by Paris standards, the room was clean and reasonably comfortable however we did have to put our own curtains up as the staff 'didn't get around to it'! However we really didn't spend much time in the room as it was simply a place to go to at the end of a long day. Fantastic, quiet location, close to Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triumph and with some nice restaurants close by (we didn't use the hotel for breakfast for dinner) A good base but not amazing, as we ended up staying for 2 nights we did move hotels the second night just to try something different! Parking nearby (5 mins walk) was expensive at 25 euros for 24 hours but to be expected in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond!!!!”
Reviews.Author: swainyPooleDorset
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly, very close to the Eiffel Tower, very close to good restaurants, very quiet street. TIP Chinese 400 yards away is where Beyonce goes each year!!! Just excellent for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DVC1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 teenagers. We had the quadruple room, it was realy small, if you open the rollaway bed, there's hardly any space to walk around. So it's basically just a place to sleep in while in Paris. Having said that we had a pleasant stay, all the staff were friendly. Nice breakfast. Mark at the front desk suggested restaurants nearby. There's a small market nearby, you can buy wine and bottled water. Tour Eiffel is just a short walk. We would definetly stay here again, but we'll leave the kids home next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJW5
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on previous reviews on this site. Wasn't disappointed. Location was fantastic, right on the seine, with Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triophe/Champs Elysees a short walk away. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby - in my opinion, the better ones were when heading away from the Eiffel Tower (Lovely little place on the Rue de Lauriston/Avenue Raymond Poincare with great service from a very charming waiter who spoke good english). Plenty of shops etc on Avenue de Champs Elysees. Metro not bad once you get used to it, but only needed it to get to Gare du Nord. Rooms were small, but clean and tidy. Can't really moan as it was a quiet, well run hotel with friendly english speaking staff. Decent price for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: waggyOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel De Longchamp for 2 nights in June, 2009. This was booked through AAA and was recommended by them. We paid $150 (US dollars). The hotel is on an ok street - there weren't many stores / restaurants right on that street, but the location was absolutely incredible. It was 2 blocks from the Trocaderro, which is a wonderful, wonderful place to go in the evening to watch the Eiffel Tower lit up. The tower lights up (in June) at approx. 9:45pm, and then at 10pm for 5 minutes the twinkling lights come on. This occurs once/hour. It was such a nice, short walk we did this both nights and enjoyed it each night!! The Trocodarro Metro stop was approx 1 1/2 blocks away. It is also approx 3 blocks to the Arch de Triumph / Champs Elyses, and is a very pleasant walk. I can't say enough about the location, if you are at all interested in walking around Paris or hopping on the metro to see the sights! The hotel itself was ok. The lobby was small and the man who checked me in was adamant that I needed some type of slip from AAA, even though my room was completely paid for ahead of time. He eventually gave me the room key, after letting me know that I really needed that voucher. Very weird. We were on the 5th floor and there's an old-fashioned elevator that you can use, but only 1 person + 1 suitcase can fit at a time, or 2 people without suitcases (ok - one time we saw 3 people smushed into the elevator together and they were cracking up because it was very, very tight). On each floor there are only a few rooms (maybe 5?). Our room was ok - kind of dark, the beds were very firm, the bathroom was actually better than I was expecting based on my impression of the room. The view from our window was to the back of other ugly buildings. We would take the elevator up, and then walk down. The hall lights are on a timer, so as you walked down towards the next floor the hall was pitch black until you walked a little further down and then the light sensor would turn on the light for that floor. The breakfast was exactly as the previous reviewer had described. It was wonderful and some of the tables looked out onto a small courtyard - it was very pleasant. We were each served 3 types of breads (a crusty french bread, a crouissant and another pastry filled with chocolate). They also served a very nice hot chocolate. It was a very, very nice way to start the day. I thought the hotel itself was ok, I thought the breakfast was lovely, and the location was absolutely incredible. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: Holidayx2fromSydney
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but adequate. Breakfast is OK with basic but enough food. Very good location - walking distance to Eiffel Tower and Arc De Triumph and close to underground rail. Staff helpful with maps and sightseeing etc. Would stay there again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: jfcdallas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel from the airport at 10:30am so our rooms were not ready we were advised to come back around noon. Mark @ the front desk recommended the bus tour of Paris, since we had been traveling all evening and well into the morning. The bus tour would be somewhat relaxing and introduce us to the city and our surroundings, which would allow us to create a game plan for the next upcoming days activities. The room was nice, clean and I soon learned in speaking with others & Mark that this is the typical sized room for most hotels in Europe. The hotel's location is between a 5-10 min. walk to either the metro or to the Eiffel Tower which we visited on several times throughout our stay, so this was really an ideal location. The hotel was right off of the busy streets, so it was nice and quiet at all times and just enough traffic to feel safe walking at any time of the day and night. Some of our other friends stayed at another hotel which was in a busy area right next to the metro line tracks and we were so glad that we did not stay there due to the busy location (Hotel Eiffel Seine) although we visited the hotel and found it nice but it was not ideal for us since we like quiet locations. Also, we received a nice continental breakfast each morning which was included in the stay, so this allowed us to get up and head down to eat and then hit the beautiful city of Paris fully charged for the days activities. I really enjoyed speaking with Mark during our stay at times we just chatted about Paris and the various cultural differences between Americans and Europeans. All of the hotel's staff were very pleasant but I must make mention that MARK is truly an asset to the hotel, since he truly made us feel welcome and recommended several excursions to us throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yoav10
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel Longshamp! Very good quiet location and only a few minutes from the Eiffel tower and steps from the trocadero metro. Every single one from the staff (Mr. Marc, Mr. de Simon and I am sorry that I can't mention the names of all the rest) was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, welcoming and well soundproofed that we didn't hear any noise, and the bed was very comfortable. Perfect for long stay (we have been there 6 nights) I would highly recommend this hotel! Yoav Israel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, somewhere clean to get your head down”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandwalkabout
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris late evening found most locations around this area very expensive. However Mick on the front deck pointed us in the rite direction he spoke great english and has a lot of information to pass to you just ask. The only food we had was breakfast which was good, set us up for the day. I had my parents with me one who has walking difs, the lift was useful to them both. I truely recommend this hotel and would stay here again. Many thanks again Mick from the N Ireland family

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review - Great Location - Crummy Room”
Reviews.Author: lauraktravels
Reviews.Content: Amazing location. Very friendly staff. Great check-in and check-out. Very quiet location. Nice continental breakfast. However, Room 10 is to be avoided! One double and one twin bed. Sounds from other rooms beside and above us, and from the interior stairway, were very disconcerting. There is a window in the room that opens onto a small interior courtyard, which was great, until somebody smoked cigarettes in the middle of the night right outside the window! We asked to see other rooms and were told that 10, the suite(!), is the room everybody wants, including ambassadors. Hmmmmm Because the location is so fantastic, I'd like to hear about other rooms from people who've stayed there recently. Thanks, and happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleGal63
Reviews.Content: This is a great little 3-star Paris hotel. Day staff is excellent, rooms and bathrooms are small (but right in line with other 3*s in Paris), but nicely appointed and very clean. Hotel is not on a busy street, but within a couple of blocks to lots of restaurants, Place de Trocadero (we walked there to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night several times), great Metro stop. Close by....a market, fruit market, bakery, laundry, etc. etc. Breakfast is very good with yogurt, fruit, good coffee, croissants and bread, cheese. Breakfast area is small, but we were there over Christmas week, so no wait or crowd. Wireless internet not cheap, but hey, it's good to get off your feet and send an e-mail with a picture attached from your day at the Louvre (or wherever) when you get back to your room. Stayed in Latin Quarter last visit and liked this area much better (more residential feel, and yet close or very accessible to everything Paris). Would stay here again any time. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place !!!”
Reviews.Author: YOYOMiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Longchamp Elysees with friends and the place is wonderful. All the staff is very helpful and the Hotel is very nice, clean and ideally lovated near the Trocadero and 10 minutes walking to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are very comfortable, breakfast is very good and everything is perfect. You have to go there absolutely. It is the pla&ce to be in Paris. Love love love....

Reviews.Title: “Nice one!”
Reviews.Author: Yournamecouldbehere
Reviews.Content: We are a family and booked a Quad room. We knew that a quad room in the centre of Paris was going to be "cosy" and were not dissapointed. However the room was clean, neat and appointed appropriately for the 3* awarded. The welcome was freindly and the room was ready upon arrival, which allowed us to unpack and walk the few minutes to the Trocadero and on to the Eiffel tower. Breakfast was continental but a good filling selection of bread, fruit, hot drinks, juice and cheese. The breakfast area is compact (you may need to wait for a table) but the staff are freindly. Overall value for money it is excellent, you may get larger rooms further out for the money, but we walked (with a 5 yr old) to many tourist places, easy access to Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located and charming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Albertagigi
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience. Ideally located in the 16th, was running every am along La Seine. Walking distance to major attractions, restaurants. Laundromat close by. Drawback internet expensive. Mc Donald has free illimited Wifi. THey gave us a bottle of Champagne for my birthday! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronen83120
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. We spent a couple of days there and were very happy. The hotel & the rooms are very clean and quite confortable, people is very nice and especially Marc and Marie. They make your stay very pleasant ad when will come back to Paris we will always stay there. The breakfast is very good and for a reasonableprice you get yoghurt fruit and cheese. The location is excellent 5 minutes walking distance from Eiffel Tower and 10 minutes from Champs Elysees. You mus choose this hotel when you come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central but no frills”
Reviews.Author: LondonUlster
Reviews.Content: This is a neat little hotel reasonably close to the Trocadero, so within spitting distance of one of the most glorious views of the Eiffel Tower. We arrived at around 11pm and couldn't gain entry. After a long spell of leaning on the bell for attention (no doubt disturbing other residents) the concierge arrived; from there on things improved. The service was friendly in this clean but no frills hotel. The room was modern but pretty cramped. Importantly however it was exceedingly quiet and a good night's sleep was had - don't be confused by the small uncomfortable pillows - there are better ones myseriously packed away in the wardrobe. The breakfast area is small and there can be a fight for tables; thankfully guests and staff alike were always keen to make room. The breakfast was basic but tasty. Without doubt it's best asset is its location to the Trocadero but I was left to wonder if the Best Western (which sits on top of the Trocadero and looks very smart for 3 stars) would be a better bet. Like any hotel in Paris you will smart when you get the bill; the hotel is fine and probably good value for Paris - would I return? Might shop around first but can't knock it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sansan50
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, great location, very good room service and friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocobeloeuil
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the longchamp hotel it was perfect and i enjoy my stay it is 2 minutes walk from the tower. the hotel is neet and quiet. the room was spacious .the staff was very helpful mainly the concierge mark help us a lot for restaurant; tours and how to take the subway.we had a wonderful timewhile staying in paris and at the hotel longchamp.we will be back to this hotel again.thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Louise131186
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing reports in Tripadvisor.com we decided to stay at this hotel in Paris. After flying to Paris we had to then suffer a very hot packed train and a cab journey, so by the time we got to the hotel all we wanted was our room and a shower! When we arrived we were told that the person previously staying in our room was sick and could not leave therefore we had to go round to their sister hotel, there was no apology and they couldnâ€™t really care less!!! After reading on Trip advisor from someone else that they had been sent round to another hotel, it seems to me they are over booking and then sending people off round the corner! We werenâ€™t happy but needed a room for the night so we walked round. What they didn't mention before they sent us on our way was their sister hotel was in the middle of complete refurbishment. The reception area was in a right mess. They bragged that they were given us one of the new refurbished rooms that had just been finished today - dread to think what it looked like before it was refurbished then! The room was tiny and claustrophobic. The bathroom was clean as it was new but still very small - if you sat on the toilet your knees touched the bath pane! No shower curtain so the water went everywhere when you had a shower. The walls are paper thin and we heard constant banging etc all night. It got worse we were rudely awoken by builders starting work at 7am!!! We left as soon as we could that morning and went back to Longchamp the room werenâ€™t much better - very small. Had much difficulty moving in the bathroom - couldnâ€™t fit two people in the bathroom at one time. However the room was clean and well kept. All in all a massive disappointment â€“ this is a poorly run hotel and I wouldnâ€™t advise anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with treatment at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holly27
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment having booked and paid in advance in March 2008 for this hotel to find on arrival late at night that we had to move to Hotel Etoile Trocadero. No apologies were made from the management. Some excuse was made that our room had some water leakage problem but I think that they were over booked. It did cause us great inconvenience and upset. We were allowed to move back the next day. The moral of the story for us is do not pay for this hotel in advance because in the event of a problem like ours you have no redress. What a pity a hotel that we chose because of such a good write up on trip advisor let itself down by this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Longchamp Elysees”
Reviews.Author: Traveler99999999
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, friedly staff (especially Marc), among few affordable places in Paris that accomodates a family of four. I arrived very early in the morning and they made a special effort to arrange the room so that I can occupay it sooner. I warmly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Longchamp”
Reviews.Author: deb-n-james
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, well maintained, clean and tidy hotel. Stayed in triple room which was plenty big enough for a family of three, with a double bed and proper third bed not just a pull out. Staff very pleasant and helpful especially Mark at the front desk. Breakfast basic but fresh and filling. Will defintely stay again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeZ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely weekend break in Paris with my husband and two children. Hotel was ok. The receptionist/concierge, Mark was lovely and went out of his way to help us . His advise made our holiday very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPeachGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel between Champs Elysess and Eiffel Tower. Great location with excellent treatment of guests! Will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Paris' Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: PunkGlamQueen
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Hotel Longchamp after reading the excellent reviews here on tripadvisor.com. We were not disappointed... The hotel is tucked away on a quiet little street off Ave Raymond Poincare'. There are shops such as a supermarket, pharmacie, pÃ¢tisserie, and lovely cafe's all within walking distance. (Just off Place de Mexico was a little mall with a huge supermarket, Sephora, and many other shops, with more shops near Place de Victor Hugo-- including a Starbucks if you are jonesing for a fix.) Just a few blocks away is the Trocadero with the most amazing view of the Tour Eiffel (just cross the street and walk down and voila! you are standing at the foot of the Eiffel Tower!) The Metro is easily accessible via either Trocadero (closest) or Victor Hugo. If you are feeling like a nice walk, mosey over to the Arc de Triomphe and down the Ave Des Champs Elysees. You can then walk straight down, through the Place de la Concorde, the Tuileries, and onto the Louvre. (Its a hike, but so beautiful, it would be sad to miss everything along the way!) The staff were all very helpful, courteous, and accomodating. We booked a triple room for myself, my husband and our 8 year old daughter. The room was HUGE by European standards and even very decently sized by American standards. Everything was spotlessly clean, and housekeeping did a wonderful job. I have no complaints whatsoever about this fine hotel, and would strongly recommend it to visitors to Paris -- we plan to stay at the Hotel Longchamp Elysees on our next visit to Paris! One last thing -- I carelessly forgot to check the desk before checking out, and had left behind my Filofax as well as some other important items. I emailed the staff and got an immediate response that they found the items and would post them asap. I think this is a testimony to the honesty of housekeeping and the general staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Longchamp Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 68 rue de Longchamp, 75116 Paris, France
